name: Liberal Takeover
description: The elections have shown the will of the people, the Partido Liberal Radical will now rule Ecuador to a brighter future!

name: Isidro Takes the Reins of Government
description: Isidro Ayora is a well known individual in Ecuador, with quite a reputation as a surgeon and patron of medical institutions in Ecuador. Now that he has been elected, he has decided to take matters into his own hands, as he knows what is best for our nation, and how to deal with the crisis we are in!

name: Liberal Hegemony
description: The PLRE has probably gained enough political capital for decades! With the back of the conservatives crushed, the long struggle between us has finally come to an end

name: Our Own Scientists
description: Even if the famous scientists that are the closest to the conservative elites are now resistant and unwilling to work on important projects, we can draw from our own pool of friends amongst the scientific community.

name: Legal Facade
description: Some of the laws we need to get the nation back on track are technically unconstitutional or break the rules of democracy, but worry not! For other laws can be passed to make it all legal. After all, we have the majority in the parliament, and that's all that matters.

name: Modernise Penal Code
description: The penal code that has been in place in Ecuador is shameful to read, considering how unfair it is and how much it serves conservative interests. Our project should be to write a fair and modern penal code for a modern nation.

name: Uphold Secularity
description: The PLRE historically opposed the domination of the church in Ecuador by promoting secularity to a national level. This work started under Alfaro's rule has to continue. First, the abuses of the conservatives in this matter have to stop. Of course, removing these conservative puppets from power will also prove itself to be useful for our political domination.

name: Banking Interests
description: The liberal elites have numerous links to the banking world, especially in Guayaquil. These close ties can lead to a national collaboration that can only be beneficial for the country.

name: Guayaquil Reborn
description: Under the rule of liberals and their investments in the capital of commerce and banking the coastal city of Guayaquil is yet again thriving after a certain stop during the conservatives' rule and it is quickly becoming the economic capital of Ecuador.

name: Economic Boom
description: The attention the liberals give to the health of the economy and the several partnerships they have with economic actors throughout the country assured the recovery of Ecuador and its plantations. The economy is booming and unemployment is rapidly decreasing to be a matter of the past.

name: Liberty can't be plead on your knees
description: Liberty can't be plead on your knees, once said the Liberal patriarch Eloy Alfaro. These words represent the liberal spirit, we want freedom and we'll fight for it at any time and at any place for the better of the people of Ecuador and for the glory of its democracy. This is what good the liberal republic can bring!

name: Gallo Steps In
description: General Gallo has stepped in to ensure our nation's economy recovers, that the Republic won't succumb to chaos and syndicalism and to keep our borders safe. Long live general Gallo!

name: State of Exception
description: Extraordinary problems demand extraordinary solutions. Our nation is on the brink of falling to anarchy or worse: to syndicalism, and only a firm hand will keep our families and faith safe. We have to declare a state of exception that will allow Gallo to suspend the constitution and ignore most limiting laws for the good of the country.

name: Deal with Syndicalist Spies
description: It is common knowledge that the bulk of syndicalist agitators in the country, be that in the PSE, in the factories or amongst the poor peasants, are spies sent by syndicalist states to destabilise Ecuador. We must hunt those fake 'militants' and make sure they won't cause any trouble ever again.

name: Ban the PSE
description: If there is a pit of foreign agitation in Ecuador it's the Partido Socialista Ecuatoriano, under the pretence of the party working fairly in the democratic environment lies the constant threat of syndicalism that can corrupt the whole country. We have to put an end to this travesty.

name: Deal with Fifth Columnists
description: Many of our army officers still cling to the idea that our government is illegitimate and reactionary. We must not let those traitors continue like that!

name: The Army Reigns
description: After taking over the government, the army must invest all levels of power in society. The army is the best fit to rule the administration, the economy, the government and everything that matters in the country.

name: Purifying Ecuador
description: The goal of Gallo is not only to protect Ecuador from all threats but also to purify its morale and its democracy by working towards removing any trace of corruption, dissidence, greed and treachery in the Ecuadorian society. Ecuador must be a moral and just nation.

name: Populist Measures
description: It is unacceptable that Ecuadorian citizens that are supposed to be protected by their state can be left alone to die in the streets. It is our Christian and patriotic duty to help them get out of their misery so that they can live a decent life in their own country.

name: Protect the Ecuadorian Morale
description: Decades of corruption and degeneracy endangered the values of our people and of our church. The new government shall protect them and make sure Ecuador will be a standard for morality.

name: A New Constitution
description: Now that Ecuador is cleaned of its destabilising elements and that its society has been purified, it might be ready to finally get a new constitution and end the junta in favour of a new democracy. We shall start working on writing such a constitution with Gallo and his closest advisers.

name: Intellectual Amnesty
description: Potentially dissident scientists have been put away or banished during the first purges of the Gallo rule but now that the country is in better shape, we can allow them to come back and help the country with their skills and knowledge.

name: Balance of Power
description: With the surprise victory of the Conservatives in the last elections a sort of balance of powers between the two main parties was put into place during the confusion. While the established liberals have been temporarily shaken, they got back on their feet to influence the republic heavily, in which the conservatives hold the actual power, leading to a situation that might finally see real political fights arise.

name: Democracy Reestablished
description: Gallo and his military clique finally resigned from power and left their own constitution as a model for the new republic. Their heavy work and active policies completely restructured Ecuadorian politics - we hope that is for the best.

name: Power to the Parliament
description: No longer shall a man take absolute power in the Republic and name himself dictator yet again, the centre of power in the new republic will not be the president any more, but the parliament and its internal fights within parties. That's real democracy!

name: Bipartisan Structures
description: The destruction or failure of political alternatives in the last years left the country with only two sensible political options: the PCE and the PLRE. With their usual grip on politics greatly diminished, those two parties now have to work together to shape the republic to their liking while sharing all its important positions.

name: Marginalisation of Radicals
description: They were hit before but they still exist: political radicals, coming from the left or the right threatens the stability of our democracy and the bipartisan status quo. They shall be fought against and marginalised from the running of democracy.

name: Building a Meritocracy
description: The goal of this new republic is not to favour the clientelism and corruption that was rampant in the old times. No, what it shall try to build is a meritocracy ensuring only the best men of our country will get to serve it and lead it to glory. Even if the selection process might be biased, it will still be better than nepotism.

name: Rally the Army to Democracy
description: The Republic couldn't exist without the army and it couldn't last without it. We have to make sure the army is on our side if we want democracy to last.

name: Technocrat Rule
description: It seems the weakening of the executive power and the disorganisation of the parliament is leaving a hole in the direction of the country. During those squabbles, the ones that ensure the country runs fine and improves are the new administrators recruited from the whole country. All together the form the technocratic elite of the Republic.

name: Interurban Cooperation
description: Instead of constantly having a fight for the most dominating city between Quito and Guayaquil we could put those fights aside and have the cities work together for the prosperity of Ecuador. After all they both have their advantages and their faults and with the rabid antagonism between the conservatives and the liberals now reduced, it could be time to launch common programs.

name: Increase Centralisation of Power
description: Now that internal competition is solved with, we have no reason to maintain several centres of power in the country. The state will run better if all of the powers are concentrated in one place for clear and straight policies to be enacted nationally.

name: Rationalised Banking System
description: The bankers, being before heavily politicised with the liberals can now more easily cooperate with technocrats or leaders of other parties. There is no way this won't lead to an economic improvement.

name: A True Democracy
description: With many of its political problems dealt with, the republic is now ready to face the test of time and continue to work towards the improvement of the Ecuadorian nation. Viva la Republica!

name: Relieve Cacao Farmers
description: Cacao is one of the most important products of our agriculture, and a large amount of our rural population grows it. With the deteriorating state of our economy, their plantations have become unprofitable and many are threatened by financial ruin. We need to aid them back onto their feet.

name: Expand the Transandino Railway
description: The Trans-Andean railway is a vital economic axis connecting our main port Guayaquil with the capital Quito. Due to harsh terrain, weather conditions and limited investments since its construction, it's in quite a bad shape. We need to rebuild and expand it to other cities of the Andes for the good of Ecuador!

name: Improve Port Infrastructure
description: Our ports are another vital economic axis. Especially Guayaquil, which is vital for both the civilian economy and the navy, has a limited port capacity, which severely limits the economy. We need to expand the port's infrastructure.

name: Manufacturing Expansion
description: Our main exports might be primary resources, but that shouldn't stop us from building up a manufacturing industry. Manufactured goods are in demand as never before, so it will be highly profitable and the investments will pay for themselves quickly.

name: Encourage Rubber Production
description: The world is coming ever closer to a second Weltkrieg, and unlike in the first one, rubber is now an essential resource required for aircraft and motorised vehicles. We will make huge profits if we increase our rubber production and exportation.

name: Diversify Export Agriculture
description: If we only produce cacao, what would happen if the price of Cacao fell quickly in a matter of weeks? In order to avoid a collapse of our agricultural sector, we need to have a diverse offer to avoid too much damage caused by price fluctuations. Why not try bananas?

name: Promote Local Consumption
description: Transportation and importation cost a good amount of money, instead we should promote local consumption. Instead of importing food from Argentina, why not eat Ecuadorian food? Furthermore this national market can help us sell our stocks in times of crisis when exports fall, better sell a product at a low price than not sell it at all.

name: State Plans
description: Our latest economic policies have helped the economy to come back on its feet, and now it can finally support larger civilian investments. The growth rate is high and stable, so why not make it even higher?

name: Increase University Funding
description: Our universities are underfunded and therefore can't function at full efficiency. Now that the economy and the state budget can finally support new investment projects, the universities should receive more funding.

name: Development of the 'Costa'
description: The Ecuadorian littoral is the most fertile part of our nation, being home to the majority of our plantations. In addition to fertile lands, it has easy access to the world market thanks to the various ports like Guayaquil. We should focus on the littoral.

name: Development of the 'Sierra'
description: The central parts of Ecuador, stuck in-between the flanks of Andes mountains, might not have the best suited land for agriculture, but some of the largest cities, especially Quito, lie in the 'Sierra'. Our industry could benefit from investments in the region.

name: Mechanisation of Cultures
description: New agricultural tools have revolutionised agriculture in the more developed nations. One of the main pillars of this agricultural revolution are new mechanised vehicles like trucks and tractors. We need to mechanise our agriculture to increase its output.

name: Industrial Agriculture
description: Agriculture and industry aren't antonyms! We should create a cooperation between our agricultural sector and the industrial sector to increase the productivity and output of the entire Ecuadorian economy.

name: Expand the Quito Industries
description: Quito is the centrepiece of the Ecuadorian industry. The largest portion of our industry is located in our beautiful capital, and its products can be found in stores around... well the few places who buy our goods. We need to invest more into its industry.

name: Promote the Factory Worker Life
description: Working in the factory isn't working yourself to death, it is working for a better life and a better future. That's what we need to make the peasants believe in order to create a larger potential workforce, creating new factories is useless if no one is there to work in them.

name: In-depth Recovery
description: Our economy has fully recovered from the economic troubles of the last years, and is now constantly growing and growing. Our industry has developed strongly and our agricultural output has hit new record numbers. Ecuador's economy is strong and will withstand the next crisis!

name: A Domestic Arms Industry
description: Most of our military equipment is currently being imported from other countries, but who can be sure that we will forever be able to depend on imports? If the world ever ends up fighting a second Weltkrieg, our guns should be Ecuadorian and not American.

name: Military Modernisation
description: While our military is ready to beat up a few protestors, it will be inadequate if Peru ever decides to take over our rightful territory that they claim as theirs. We need to modernise our armed forces to protect Ecuador from foreign threats.

name: Maintenance Effort
description: Our army is inadequately maintained. We need to increase the military budget and we need to invest more into military production capacities. The future of the Pastaza is at stake!

name: Plan Against Our Neighbours
description: Our neighbours from all sides are threats to our independence. They all have territorial claims on our small nation and if they ever attack, they won't get much farther than the border!

name: Jungle Reconnaissance
description: The Pastaza is primarily made up of jungles and dense forests. We need to adapt our reconnaissance units to this harsh environment if we wish to effectively repel Peruvian offensives.

name: Control the Jungles
description: If we control the jungle, Peru won't even be able to enter it. The jungle is an extremely harsh environment, so whoever is the most adapted to it has a large advantage on the battlefield.

name: Weltkrieg Artillery Tactics
description: The Weltkrieg has revolutionised military tactics, and artillery tactics have changed the most. We should adapt our artillery units to these new tactics, else we will lose the advantage on longer ranges.

name: Offensive Planning
description: It would be foolish to only defend. Never has a nation won by simply defending, the Napoleonic Wars and the Weltkrieg have proven that well enough. We need to plan for offensive capabilities.

name: Reorganise Our Border Forces
description: Our border with Peru is inadequately defended, and our border with Colombia can't even be talked about. We need to reorganise and expand the border patrols and garrisons.

name: Special Forces Experiments
description: The central regions of Ecuador, part of the Andes, are made up of extremely difficult, mountainous terrain that no ordinary soldier can fight in. We need to experiment with specialised units who can fight in difficult terrain.

name: Early Motorisation
description: Our roads might be underdeveloped and our terrain might be difficult, but that shouldn't stop us from partially motorising our supply system. Besides, motorised vehicles allow for much more than just the transportation of soup.

name: Salvage American Trucks
description: The Americans left Ecuador when their influence dropped too low, but they haven't taken everything with them. We should salvage some of their abandoned trucks and use them for our own usage.

name: Quito Perimeter
description: Our beautiful capital city is in a very defensible location up in the Andes. However, that doesn't mean that it is invulnerable. We need to further fortify Quito and have it serve as a stronghold in case of a successful foreign invasion.

name: Armada de Ecuador
description: Our navy is quite large in comparison to our size. However, it is still smaller than some of our rivals' navies, most importantly that of Peru. We need to further expand our naval forces in order to defend our shores.

name: Expand the Guayaquil Naval Base
description: Guayaquil is the most important naval base in Ecuador. Most of our exports leave its docks and it is the home base of our naval forces. We need to further invest in it to increase its capacity for trade and ships.

name: Protect the Guayaquil Base
description: Guayaquil is vital to us, and the enemy knows that. If we lose its port, our naval forces and our economy will be in quite a bad shape. We need to protect its docks at all costs.

name: Create Ecuadorian Dockyards
description: Our merchant and combat ships are both constructed on foreign soil, however, we can't depend on the world to build our ships forever. We need to construct proper Ecuadorian dockyards.

name: Naval Research Progress
description: In the new naval arms race that is emerging in the world, we can't fall behind. We need to invest more into the development and construction of new modern ships.

name: Develop Capital Ships
description: Every prestigious navy has a large flagship. Our navy, despite its size, should also get a proper flagship of its own! We need to develop capital ships powerful enough to rival the Peruvians.

name: A Galapagos Base
description: The Galapagos Islands are perfectly suited for a naval base in the Pacific. Due to their isolated location, they will be perfect for Ecuadorian ships as a base to intercept enemy trade and supply going through the Panama Canal and to assert our control over our seas further than Guayaquil.

name: Control Our Seas
description: The sea around Ecuador and all the way to the Galapagos shall forever be controlled by Ecuador: it is in our vital interest... as long as no larger navy actually tries to contest it.

name: Develop the School of Aviation
description: A school of aviation was built in Ecuador no earlier than in 1935 following several developments in the Ecuadorian aviation after the Weltkrieg. It is in our interest to make the best use of this school we can to exploit this entirely new and powerful military wing.

name: Modern Air Bases
description: An aircraft can't take off effectively from the improvised airfields we've built over the years. Modern aircraft require specialised runways to take-off and land successfully and hangars to protect the planes from the weather. The local airfield in Quito could become a modern air base with enough investment, and that's what we shall focus on.

name: The First Fighter Battalion
description: We have finally equipped our air force so far composed mostly of reconnaissance and training planes with its first fighter aircraft. These beautiful single-engine planes will fly our nation to new heights.

name: Sobre Selvas, Volcanes y Mares
description: The new motto of our air force is "Sobre Selvas, Volcanes y Mares", over jungles, volcanoes and seas, to protect all of Ecuador from foreign threats. The motto of our rival will be 'crashing in the jungle' once they meet our pilots.

name: Gifts for our Enemies
description: Modern warfare has proven the need for bombers that can deliver sizeable damage to enemy production lines and infrastructure with their precious explosive payload. As it stands, Ecuador doesn't possess any aircraft with those characteristics, and we should focus on investing in newer models if we wish to stand a chance against our aggressors.
